A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I am glad some viewers appreciate this movie. And I understand and respect the opinion and reasoning of those who do. However\, to me\, this is a very disappointing movie. I'm not opposed to the addition of new characters or the departure of old ones\, but I strongly oppose (what\, in my opinion\, is) a departure from the heritage and spirit of the franchise. With such a wealth of financial resources and existing source material at the disposal of the studio\, there is simply no excuse for a choppy\, poorly plotted film that ventures so far from previous installments.\n\nP. S. When did it become okay to have swearing (\"damn\,\" \"bastard\,\" etc.) in a Star Wars movie? One of the biggest appeals of this franchise used to be its kid- and family-friendliness.
